resumeContent:
# Xuteng Lin

**Embedded Systems Engineer | Product Design Engineer**

üìç Melbourne, Australia (Permanent Resident) | üíº [LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/in/xuteng-lin-7b0321121) | ‚úâÔ∏è xutengl@outlook.com

## CAREER OBJECTIVE

Motivated firmware engineer aiming to advance into regulated medical device development, gaining hands-on experience with ISO 13485 QMS and IEC 62304. Skilled in embedded systems, RTOS, embedded Linux, STM32/nRF, and IoT/cloud, with a proven record of delivering reliable, real-world products. Eager to contribute technical expertise and collaborative problem-solving to projects that create positive human impact, while actively developing skills to incorporate test-driven design into embedded workflows.

## CORE SKILLS

**Embedded Systems:** C/C++, Python, FreeRTOS, Zephyr, ESP-IDF, STM32 HAL, nRF SDK, LVGL, LWIP

**Embedded Linux & OS:** Buildroot, Manjaro, Ubuntu Desktop & Server, ROS, bash/zsh, VirtualBox, Samba

**Protocols:** CAN, RS485, Modbus RTU, I2C, SPI, UART, Ethernet, MIPI-CSI, DVP, proprietary protocols

**PCB Design:** KiCad, EasyEDA, Altium 365, PCBway, JLCPCB PCBA

**Mechanical Design:** SolidWorks, Fusion 360, OnShape, DFM, 3D printing, CNC, sheet metal cut & bend

**Web & Cloud:** Svelte, Bootstrap, REST API, WebSocket

**Tools:** Git, Confluence, JIRA, MATLAB

## PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE

### Firmware Engineer, Pixel Technologies Pty Ltd, Melbourne
**Apr 2023 ‚Äì Present**

- Developed and deployed firmware for ESP32 and NXP i.MX platforms in elevator IoT systems deployed worldwide
- Implemented RS485, CAN, Ethernet, I2C, SPI, and integrated proprietary elevator protocols (KONE, OTIS, Smartrise)
- Created embedded web apps (Svelte, Bootstrap) with REST API/WebSocket for remote configuration & monitoring
- Built OTA update system with SHA verification, progress tracking, and recovery features, reducing update failures
- Automated unit testing for ESP32 web features using Ubuntu Server on Raspberry Pi
- Provided on-site and remote client support, resolving hardware/software issues under tight timeframes

### Product Design Engineer (Casual), Product Design Lab, Melbourne
**Nov 2023 ‚Äì Present**

- Delivered proof-of-concept devices for multiple early-stage medtech and product development clients, including Vysum, Virtetic, Misti
- Designed and debugged custom PCBs; performed SMD rework and component-level troubleshooting
- Developed firmware for nRF52 MCUs using Zephyr/Arduino frameworks; optimised sensor drivers for real-time event detection
- Evaluated sensor options, customised sensor driver to allow FIFO-based data acquisition
- Collaborated with industrial designers, mechanical engineers, and founders to meet R&D milestones

### Research Engineer, University of Melbourne, Melbourne
**Dec 2020 ‚Äì Sep 2022**

- Led embedded, electrical, and mechanical design for an AGV prototype in mining applications
- Developed STM32 FreeRTOS firmware and ROS integration on NVIDIA Jetson (Ubuntu)
- Implemented PID and Kalman Filter algorithms for motion control and sensor fusion
- Coordinated suppliers, managed integration testing, and delivered successful field deployments
- Co-authored a peer-reviewed robotics journal paper

## VOLUNTEERING & LEADERSHIP

### Chief Product Officer, MBSI
**2023 ‚Äì 2024**

- Oversaw product development across multiple projects

### Integration & Product Development Lead, MBSI
**2022 ‚Äì 2023**

- Led embedded integration for Sensure Medical (wearable health monitor) and Cerece Project (brain-computer interface prototype)

## EDUCATION

**Master of Engineering (Mechatronics)** ‚Äì University of Melbourne | 2019 ‚Äì 2020

- Led exoskeleton enhancement project for Cybathlon competition

**Bachelor of Science (Mechanical Engineering)** ‚Äì University of Melbourne | 2015 ‚Äì 2018

- Team Leader, Warman Design & Build Competition ‚Äì Campus Winner, 4th APAC Final

## PUBLICATIONS

**Y. Xie, X. Lin**, J. Zou, B. Wu, A. Qin. *Development of Autonomous Conveyor Carryback Removal Vehicle*, *Journal of Robotics and Mechatronics*, 2024. [DOI](https://doi.org/10.1142/S2301385024500353)
